== Main Inclusion Report for ecosconfig-imx ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://ports.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/r/redboot-imx]]</nowiki>; available for armel
# ''Rationale:''
** a bootloader needed on the imx51 Babbage board; needed for live images.
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=redboot|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: 0 for ecosconfig, 1 for ecos in 2006, but didn't affect RedBoot
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=redboot|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: None
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** No daemons.
** Can use the network to download images over TFTP/HTTP, but does not use it by default, and can only access to local LAN (routing is not supported)
** Processes the binaries of linux and its ram disk, as well as the flash map, and configuration partition
** No source code review performed.
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** RedBoot has its own internal configuration partition; no config files
** No debconf questions asked
** No Debian package.
** Upstream for this package (Freescale Semiconductors) is calm.
** No upstream bug tracker.
** Hardware: imxXX series SoCs. Currently only the imx51 is supported.
    - The currently only supported target is the imx51-babbage board; but there may be addition targets added
** No test suite.
 0. ''UI standards:''
** No user-visible UI; there is a command line on the serial console however.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance
** <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards compliance
** Packaging system: debhelper
** Patch system: dpatch
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** tcl-dev, tk-dev, econsconfig
** All build-deps except ecosconfig are in main. ecosconfig has an outstanding MIR.
 0. ''Maintenance:''
** This is a low maintenance package; it will only have to be touched if a new upstream release is given by Freescale
** The Ubuntu Mobile Team is responsible for this package; they are Ubuntu developers.
 0. ''Background information:''
** None.
 0. ''Internationalization:''
** No GUI apps.

=== Reviewers ===

MIR bug: <nowiki>[[https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/redboot-imx/+bug/345294]]</nowiki>
